title: 3D Gamification-Based Human Resource Development Education Design in Mathematics: Integrated Approach to Spatial Geometry, Probability, and Statistics

context.prior_knowledge: Basic instructional design theory, mathematics education methodologies (spatial geometry, probability, statistics, equation modeling), foundational understanding of 3D tools, and graphic interface manipulation skills
context.additional_context: 3D sandbox game-based learning using personal devices (BYOD), focusing on visualizing math concepts (coordinate systems, function graphs) and verifying educational effectiveness through data analysis (mean, standard deviation, correlation). Includes hypothesis verification and evidence collection via in-game virtual experiments.

learning_goals: Learners can design PBL projects in a 3D gamified environment to operate human resource development training programs that enhance mathematical problem-solving skills in spatial geometry, probability, and statistics.

Using 3D sandbox tools similar to Creativerse, learners can implement math-based educational scenarios such as polygonal volume calculations, probability distribution simulations, and statistical graph visualizations.

By analyzing learning outcome metrics (PE, EE, SI, FC), learners can improve educational satisfaction by 20% or more and demonstrate instructional effectiveness based on data on math concept application.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
